page.title: 02ARMY CADET FORCE
page.content: The Army Cadet Force is a youth organisation for young boys aged between 13 and 18 years of age. Its training is based on the same type as the army but it is not taught at such a high level. There is also training based on civilian needs such as first aid. The Army Cadets meet at the Hythe Hut every Tuesday and Thursday. There are also plenty of weekend camps and exercises and every year there is an annual camp. At Hythe there are 30 cadets and the hut receives a lot of help from the army base at Marchwood. The regiment under which the cadets are based is the Royal Corps of Transport which is the same as Marchwood so the cadets do a lot of driving and training at the base.
